intro: Ipomoea ocularis, commonly known as the eye of the bat, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trailing vines and showy flowers. The plant produces trumpet-shaped blooms that are typically blue or violet in color, often with a distinctive white or yellow eye-like marking. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and tend to climb or trail along the ground. Ipomoea ocularis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and tropical landscapes.
